data.title: 2016 NBA Champion Cleveland Cavaliers: Where are they now
data.meta_description: Looking back at the 2016 NBA Champion Cleveland Cavaliers, and where the players are now
data.text:
June 19, 2016 will be a day the people of Cleveland will never forget. That was the day the Cavaliers beat the Golden State Warriors 93-89 in Game 7 of the NBA Finals to bring a title to Cleveland.

LeBron James, Kyrie Irving, Kevin Love and crew came back from a 3-1 series deficit to bring home the city's first title since the Browns in 1964.

Love and Matthew Dellavedova are the only members of the champions to still play for the Cavs. Here's a look at what the rest of the roster has been up to in the past five years.

Matthew Dellavedova

POSITION: Guard

2015-16 STATS: 7.5 ppg, 4.4 apg, .864 FT%, .410 3PT%

2016 FINALS STATS: 2.7 ppg, 1.0 apg, .833 FT%

WHERE IS HE NOW: The Cavaliers traded him to the Bucks following the 2015-16 season. Following three seasons in Milwaukee, Dellavedova ended up back in Cleveland following a three-team trade and has spent the past three seasons with the Cavaliers.

Played in only 13 games this season due to injury.

Channing Frye

POSITION: Forward

2015-16 STATS: 6.1 ppg, 3.3 rpg, .857 FT%

2016 FINALS STATS: 0.5 ppg, 0.8 rpg, 0.5 bpg

WHERE IS HE NOW: Stayed with the Cavs until he was traded to the Lakers in the 2018 trade that brought Jordan Clarkson and Larry Nance Jr. to Cleveland. Re-signed with the Cavs for the 2018-19 season – his last year in the NBA.

Now works for NBA TV and for the NBA on TNT. Also one of the hosts of the Road Trippin’ podcast with Richard Jefferson and Allie Clifton.

Kyrie Irving

POSITION: Guard

2015-16 STATS: 19.6 ppg, 4.7 apg, .885 FT%

2016 FINALS STATS: 27.1 ppg, 3.9 apg, 3.9 rpg, .939 FT%

WHERE IS HE NOW: Played one more season for the Cavs before being traded to the Celtics.

Played two seasons in Boston before signing with the Nets in free agency. The seven-time all-star is currently chasing another championship with Brooklyn.

LeBron James

POSITION: Forward

2015-16 STATS: 25.3 ppg, 7.4 rpg, 6.8 apg, 1.4 spg

2016 FINALS STATS: 29.7 ppg, 11.3 rpg, 8.9 apg, 2.6 spg, 2.3 bpg

WHERE IS HE NOW: Played two more seasons with the Cavs before signing with the Lakers.

The four-time NBA MVP won another championship and picked up another Finals MVP when Los Angeles won the title in 2020.

The Lakers just lost in the first round to the Suns this season.

Richard Jefferson

POSITION: Forward

2015-16 STATS: 5.5 ppg, 1.7 rpg

2016 FINALS STATS: 5.7 ppg, 5.3 rpg, 1.3 spg

WHERE IS HE NOW: Played another season in Cleveland before finishing up his career in 2017-18 with the Nuggets.

Has worked as an announcer for the ESPN, FS1, the YES Network and the Pac-12 Network. Also one of the hosts of the Road Trippin' podcast with Channing Frye and Allie Clifton.

Dahntay Jones

POSITION: Guard

2015-16 STATS: Played in one game, scoring 13 points

2016 FINALS STATS: 1.3 ppg, .800 FT%

WHERE IS HE NOW: Played only two regular-season games for the Cavs across two seasons before retiring after 2016-17.

Currently a player development basketball coach for the Clippers.

James Jones

POSITION: Forward

2015-16 STATS: 3.7 ppg

2016 FINALS STATS: played 20 minutes across five games

WHERE IS HE NOW: Finished up his playing career in 2016-17 while a member of the Cavs.

In July of 2017 he was named the vice president of basketball operations for the Phoenix Suns, helping put together a roster that has advanced to the Western Conference finals this season.

Sasha Kaun

POSITION: Center

2015-16 STATS: 0.9 ppg, 1.0 rpg

2016 FINALS STATS: DNP

WHERE IS HE NOW: Was traded to Philadelphia after the championship season. Six days after he was waived by the Sixers he announced his retirement from basketball.

Kevin Love

POSITION: Forward

2015-16 STATS: 16.0 ppg, 9.9 rpg

2016 FINALS STATS: 8.5 ppg, 6.8 rpg

WHERE IS HE NOW: Still a member of the Cavaliers, where he was named an all-star during the 2017 and 2018 seasons.

Injuries limited him to 22 games in 2018-19 and 25 games in 2020-21. Grabbed his 8,000th career rebound this past season and went over 13,000 points for his career.

Jordan McRae

POSITION: Guard

2015-16 STATS: 4.5 ppg, .455 3PT%

2016 FINALS STATS: Scored four points in 2:57 of play in Game 3

WHERE IS HE NOW: Was waived by the Cavs during the 2016-17 season.

Spent time with Washington, Denver and Detroit.

Signed with the Beijing Ducks of the Chinese Basketball Association for the 2020-21 season where he's a teammate of Jeremy Lin.

Timofey Mozgov

POSITION: Center

2015-16 STATS: 6.3 ppg, 4.4 rpg, .565 FG%

2016 FINALS STATS: 1.4 ppg, 1.6 rpg

WHERE IS HE NOW: Along with Cavs teammate Sasha Kaun, became the first Russian players to win an NBA title.

Signed with the Lakers for the 2016-17 season, traded to the Nets for 2017-18 and traded to the Magic for 2018-19 – his final NBA season.

Played for Khimki of the VTB United League and the EuroLeague in 2019-20.

Iman Shumpert

POSITION: Guard

2015-16 STATS: 5.8 ppg, 3.8 rpg

2016 FINALS STATS: 3.0 ppg, 1.6 rpg

WHERE IS HE NOW: Played another two seasons in Cleveland after winning the championship.

Split the 2018-19 season between the Kings and the Rockets. Has played in 15 games over the past two seasons with the Nets.

Released an EP titled 'Substance Abuse' in 2018.

J.R. Smith

POSITION: Guard

2015-16 STATS: 12.4 ppg, 1.1 spg, .400 3PT%

2016 FINALS STATS: 10.6 ppg, 2.7 rpg, 1.6 apg, 1.4 spg

WHERE IS HE NOW: Played with the Cavs all the way trough 2018-19 before being waived in the offseason.

Reunited with LeBron James on the Lakers for the 2019-20 season and picked up another championship.

Has his own channel on Twitch, swishgaming.

Tristan Thompson

POSITION: Forward

2015-16 STATS: 7.8 ppg, 9.0 rpg, .588 FG%

2016 FINALS STATS: 10.3 ppg, 10.1 rpg, .636 FG%

WHERE IS HE NOW: Played with the Cavs through the 2019-20 season. Averaged a career-high 12.0 points to go along with 10.1 rebounds per game in 19-20.

Signed with the Celtics for the 2020-21 season. Averaged 7.6 points and 8.1 rebounds per game with Boston.

The Brampton, Ontario native became a U.S. citizen in November, 2020.

Mo Williams

POSITION: Guard

2015-16 STATS: 8.2 ppg, 2.4 apg, .905 FT%

2016 FINALS STATS: 1.5 ppg, .5 rpg, .5 spg

WHERE IS HE NOW: The 2015-16 season was the last time Williams appeared in an NBA game.

He spent much of 2016-17 being traded and waived by several teams without ever appearing in a game.

He began a coaching career in 2018 at Cal State Northridge, where he served two years as an assistant coach.
